features.title: Add references/citations section to generated articles
features.description: Enhance Writer Agent to include properly formatted references section citing sources used in article research. This improves content credibility and provides readers with source attribution.
features.user_story: As a reader, I need to see references and citations for article claims so that I can verify information and explore sources.
acceptance_criteria: All generated articles include 'References' section before closing
References formatted in Economist style (Author, 'Title', Publication, Date)
Research Agent sources automatically included in references
Links to sources include proper anchor text (not 'click here')
Publication Validator blocks articles without references section

content_quality.citation_accuracy: URLs must be functional and match source
content_quality.fact_checking: All statistics must have corresponding reference

accessibility.link_text: Descriptive anchor text, not generic 'click here'
accessibility.screen_reader: References list must be semantic <ol> or <ul>

seo.external_links: Include rel='nofollow' for external sources if policy requires

maintainability.test_coverage: Validator tests for references section presence and format

features.reclassification_reason: This was incorrectly logged as a bug. The requirement for a references section was never specified in the original Writer Agent story. This is a new feature request, not a defect. The system worked as designed - it's the requirements that were incomplete.

requirements_traceability.requirement_note: Original story specified: 'Generate Economist-style articles with proper structure, voice, and data integration.' References section was not explicitly required or forbidden. This is specification evolution, not implementation failure.

implementation_notes: Enhance WRITER_AGENT_PROMPT with references section template
Add Publication Validator check #8 for references presence
Update Blog QA agent to validate reference formatting
Research Agent already collects sources - need to format for output
